area_name: Island aka Left side of Cabin Wall, The

climbs.name: Willy's Hand Jive
climbs.fa: Chuck Grossman, Chris Begue, and friend, 1982

content.description:
This is the obvious, splitter crack across the gully from

S-Crack

. Climb tight hands to perfect big hands (#3 Camalot) to a funky pod (crux). It is slightly overhanging for most of the way. Excellent.
content.protection: #1s, #2s and #3s (Camalots). Maybe a #4 just below the pod.
content.location:
This is across the gully from

S-Crack

. It is easy to see from the parking area.

content.description:
The crux of climbing this hoodoo is all mental. We climbed the side facing the road. Climb tentatively up the hoodoo, stand on the summit rock, and downclimb off.

This provides a quick bit of excitement while you're in the area.
content.location:
Whodini is the only hoodoo in between the wall that has

Willy's Hand Jive

and the wall that has

S Crack

.

content.description: This climbs a cupped hands corner to an OW roof.  It starts out okay, but it deteriorates at the wide roof. The route requires some wide stuff for pro, or you can just punch it to the anchor.
content.protection: #3-#5 Camalots. Bolted anchor with rope and biner.
content.location:
This is roughly 100 feet climber's left of

WHJ

.

content.description:
I don't know the name of this one, let me know if you do!

Start up the easier fingers layback with lots of feet features before passing the crux roof. It is tougher than it looks! After this, it's pody hands to the top. Save a 0.75 for the top. This is a good line with rock quality that gets better at the roof.
content.protection: A 0.3, 0.4, (2) 0.5, (2) 0.75, 1, and a 2. There is a 2 bolt anchor and webbing with 2 rap rings.
content.location:
It is located just right of

Aunt Jemima's Hand Stack

on the shady side.

content.description:
Climb a corner to a lieback/undercling 2" crack through roof to good handjam at lip. It is a 1.5-2" corner to the top. CLASSIC PITCH!

The name of the route comes from a peregrine falcon that attacked the FA team.
content.protection: 1" to 2" camming units of your choice.  There are new anchors at the top.
content.location:
This is about 50 feet climber's right of

Willy's Hand Jive

. It is an obvious corner with roof/corner about 30 feet up.

content.description: Start out fun with 1-1.5 inch, left-facing corner to a roof.  When you get to the roof, the quality goes down a bit due to poor rock.  Place a 2" cam at the roof and lieback/undercling to lip where it becomes 1" to the anchor.
content.location:
This is to the climber's left of

WHJ

.

climbs.name: Better Left Undone
climbs.fa: Chuck Grossman and Peter Delanoy 1982 (first roof)/Chuck Grossman and Chris Begue 1984 (completed)

content.description: Climb up a chossy start to the roof and place a piece or two, turn the roof on good hands, and then continue as it gets wider and wider.
content.protection: Bring doubles of #2s to 6s maybe a Big-bro or just runout to the anchors on the ledge.
content.location:
It is right of

Pair a'grins

and

Willy's

, the obvious roof.

content.description: This is a right side in offwidth crack. It is harder than it looks.
content.location:
It is around the corner (up canyon) from

Willy's Hand Jive

.

pathTokens: Island aka Left side of Cabin Wall, The
